ground_truth: David gets startled, puts back the clippings, stuffs the new one inside with them, replaces it back on the top shelf, and leaves the closet. He opens the door to find Audrey standing in the darkened hall. Audrey nods, and David stares at his wife as she starts crying with tears rolling over her affected face. She tries to wipe them away, but there's too many. Audrey nods, walks down the stairs as she wipes her face, and David watches her disappear into the shadows. The cavernous stadium opens up into a picture-perfect blue sky, with a line of ticket holders snaking towards two turnstiles where the stadium crew is ripping tickets. David Dunne stands to one side with two other security guards, observing the fans clad in Eagles paraphernalia. A group of girls carries a homemade banner that David reads as he tilts his head sideways. He stares at a woman carrying a newborn infant in her arms, noticing the baby wearing an Eagles uniform. The walkie-talkie on David's hip bursts to life, and he pulls it off to listen. David bumps into a guy in line wearing an army jacket, then looks back at him and continues walking. David moves to a security guard near the turnstiles, walks to his post near the gate, and faces the crowd. Elijah moves next to him and observes as a security team pats down random males moving through the turnstiles. The green army-jacketed man moves forward in line with a blank face, watching the pat-down ahead of him. David eyes him as he is twenty people from the turnstile, then fifteen, then ten. The man coughs, steps out of line, and Elijah watches the green army jacket melt into the thick crowd, disappearing as it moves away from the stadium. In an unlit arched concrete passageway, sunlight from the stadium streams in causing long shadows. Elijah stands waiting in the ground tunnel by himself until David enters the tunnel and joins him, handing him a ticket. Elijah stares at David, who exhales slowly while staring back. David's walkie erupts with noise, and the two men stand very still in the tunnel. David turns, starts down the hall, and talks back over his shoulder as Elijah watches the silhouetted figure of David Dunne jog beyond down the darkness of the tunnel. Inside a customized car, the dashboard is covered in thin foam padding, as are the steering wheel and gear shift, with every corner and hard surface safeguarded. Elijah sits behind the wheel in the car parked in the stadium lot.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: David becomes shocked, places back the clippings, stuffs the new one inside with them, puts it back on the top shelf, and exits the closet. He opens the door to find Audrey standing in the shadowed corridor. Audrey nods, and David gazes at his wife as she begins weeping with tears cascading over her affected face. She attempts to wipe them away, but there's too many. Audrey nods, walks down the stairs as she wipes her face, and David watches her vanish into the shadows. The cavernous arena opens up into a picture-perfect azure sky, with a line of ticket holders winding towards two turnstiles where the arena crew is tearing tickets. David Dunne stands to one side with two other security guards, observing the fans clad in Eagles gear. A group of girls carries a homemade banner that David reads as he tilts his head sideways. He gazes at a woman carrying a newborn infant in her arms, noticing the baby wearing an Eagles outfit. The walkie-talkie on David's hip bursts to life, and he pulls it off to listen. David bumps into a guy in line wearing an army jacket, then looks back at him and continues walking. David moves to a security guard near the turnstiles, walks to his post near the gate, and faces the crowd. Elijah moves next to him and observes as a security team pats down random males moving through the turnstiles. The green army-jacketed man advances in line with a blank face, watching the pat-down ahead of him. David eyes him as he is twenty people from the turnstile, then fifteen, then ten. The man coughs, steps out of line, and Elijah watches the green army jacket melt into the thick crowd, vanishing as it moves away from the arena. In an unlit arched concrete passageway, sunlight from the arena streams in causing long shadows. Elijah stands waiting in the ground tunnel by himself until David enters the tunnel and joins him, handing him a ticket. Elijah gazes at David, who exhales slowly while staring back. David's walkie erupts with noise, and the two men stand very still in the tunnel. David turns, starts down the corridor, and talks back over his shoulder as Elijah watches the silhouetted figure of David Dunne jog beyond down the darkness of the tunnel. Inside a customized car, the dashboard is covered in thin foam padding, as are the steering wheel and gear shift, with every corner and hard surface protected. Elijah sits behind the wheel in the car parked in the arena lot.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: The clippings are put back by David, the new one is stuffed inside with them by him, it is replaced back on the top shelf, and the closet is left by him. The door is opened by him to find Audrey standing in the darkened hall. Audrey nods, and his wife is stared at by David as tears start rolling down her affected face while she cries. They are tried to be wiped away by her, but there are too many. Audrey nods, walks down the stairs while wiping her face, and she is watched by David as she disappears into the shadows. A picture-perfect blue sky opens up into the cavernous stadium, with a line of ticket holders snaking towards two turnstiles where tickets are being ripped by the stadium crew. David Dunne stands with two other security guards, observing the fans clad in Eagles paraphernalia. A homemade banner is carried by a group of girls that David tilts his head to read. A woman carrying a newborn infant in her arms is stared at by him, and the baby is noticed to be wearing an Eagles uniform by David. The walkie-talkie on his hip bursts to life, and it is pulled off him as he listens. A guy in line wearing an army jacket is bumped into by David, and the guy is looked at by him before he continues walking. He moves to a security guard near the turnstiles, walks to his post near the gate, and faces the crowd. Elijah moves next to him and observes as a security team pats down random males moving through the turnstiles. Forward in line moves the green army-jacketed man with a blank face, watching the pat-down ahead of him. He is eyed by David as he approaches the turnstile being twenty people away, then fifteen, then ten. The man coughs, steps out of line, and Elijah watches as the green army jacket melts into the thick crowd, disappearing as it moves away from the stadium. In an unlit arched concrete passageway, sunlight from the stadium causes long shadows. In the ground tunnel, Elijah stands waiting by himself until the tunnel is entered by David who joins him and hands him a ticket. David is stared at by Elijah, who exhales slowly while staring back. David's walkie erupts with noise, and very still both men stand in the tunnel. He turns, starts down the hall, and talks back over his shoulder while Elijah watches as the silhouetted figure of David Dunne jogs beyond down the darkness of the tunnel. Inside a customized car, thin foam padding covers the dashboard, as are the steering wheel and gear shift, with every corner and hard surface safeguarded. Behind the wheel sits Elijah in the car parked in the stadium lot.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: David, startled, puts back the clippings, stuffs the new one inside, returns it to the top shelf, and exits the closet. He opens the door to find Audrey in the dark hall. Audrey nods, and David watches her cry, tears streaming down her face. Trying to wipe them, Audrey descends the stairs as David watches her disappear into the shadows. The stadium opens under a perfect blue sky; a line of ticket holders snakes toward two turnstiles. David Dunne stands with two other security guards, observing fans in Eagles gear. He reads a homemade banner held by girls and notices a woman holding a baby in an Eagles uniform. His walkie-talkie crackles, and he listens, bumping into an army jacket-wearing man in line. David moves to the turnstiles, taking his post. Elijah stands next to him, observing the security team patting down males. The man in the army jacket advances, blank-faced, before stepping out of line, disappearing into the crowd. In a dim concrete passageway, sunlight casts long shadows. Elijah waits until David arrives and hands him a ticket. They stare at each other, and David's walkie erupts. David turns, talks over his shoulder, and jogs into the tunnel, with Elijah watching. Inside a customized car in the stadium lot, Elijah sits behind a padded dashboard.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: David gets startled, returns the clippings, puts the new one inside, and leaves the closet. He finds Audrey in the dark hall; she nods, crying uncontrollably. She wipes her face while David watches her descend the stairs into darkness. The stadium reveals a blue sky, with ticket holders lining up. David, with security colleagues, observes fans in Eagles gear. A group of girls carries a banner, and David notices a baby in an Eagles uniform. His walkie-talkie activates; he listens, bumps a man in an army jacket, and resumes walking. David reaches the turnstile, joins Elijah observing security pat-downs. The army-jacketed man coughs and leaves the line, vanishing into the crowd. In a dim passageway, Elijah waits until David arrives with a ticket. They exchange looks as David's walkie erupts again. David departs down the hall; Elijah watches him jog into the tunnel's shadows. Elijah sits in a padded car parked in the stadium lot.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: David, unexpectedly jolted by the situation, hurriedly returns the clippings to their place, carefully tucks the new one inside with the others, places the entire collection back onto the top shelf, and exits the small, confined closet space. As he opens the door wide, he is greeted by the sight of Audrey standing quietly in the dimly lit hallway. With a subtle nod, Audrey acknowledges David, who finds himself fixated on his wife as she begins to cry uncontrollably, tears streaming down her distraught face. She attempts to wipe the tears away with her hands, but they are too plentiful to manage effectively. Audrey nods once more, descends the stairs while still wiping her face, and David watches somberly as she fades into the shadows below. The vast expanse of the stadium unfolds into a picturesque, clear blue sky, with a line of eager ticket holders winding their way towards two bustling turnstiles where the dedicated stadium staff is busy tearing tickets. Positioned to one side, David Dunne stands alongside two other vigilant security guards, closely observing the enthusiastic fans decked out in their Eagles-themed clothing and accessories. Nearby, a group of animated girls carries a homemade banner, prompting David to tilt his head to read the message carefully. His gaze shifts to a woman cradling a newborn baby in her arms; he notices the infant is adorably dressed in an Eagles uniform. Suddenly, the walkie-talkie on David's hip crackles to life, and he quickly detaches it to listen intently. As he navigates through the crowd, he accidentally bumps into a man wearing a distinctive army jacket, glancing back momentarily before continuing on his way. David makes his way over to a fellow security guard posted near the turnstiles and assumes his position close to the gate, facing the throng of spectators. Elijah approaches him and watches as the security team diligently pats down random male attendees passing through the turnstiles. The man in the green army jacket shuffles forward in the line wearing an inscrutable expression, watching the pat-down procedures ahead of him. David keeps a close eye on him as he progresses to being twenty people away from the turnstile, then fifteen, and eventually just ten. The man suddenly coughs, stepping out of the line abruptly, and Elijah observes as the distinctive green army jacket blends seamlessly into the thick crowd, disappearing as the man retreats from the stadium vicinity. In a shadowy, unlit arched concrete passageway, sunlight streams in from the stadium, casting elongated shadows across the space. Elijah stands alone, patiently waiting in the ground tunnel until David makes his entrance, joining him and handing over a ticket. Elijah stares at David, who exhales in a measured, deliberate manner while maintaining eye contact. As David's walkie erupts with more noise, the two men remain perfectly still within the confines of the tunnel. David turns away, beginning to move down the hallway, speaking over his shoulder as Elijah observes the silhouetted figure of David Dunne as he jogs into the depths of the tunnel's darkness. Seated inside a uniquely customized car, Elijah is behind the wheel in the stadium parking lot. The dashboard is covered with a layer of thin foam padding, as are the steering wheel and gear shift, with every corner and hard surface carefully safeguarded for protection.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: David, caught completely off guard by the unfolding situation, quickly returns the clippings to their original spot. He carefully inserts the new clipping among the others, treating the entire collection with utmost care as he places it back onto the highest shelf. With a sense of urgency, he exits the cramped, confined closet space. As David swings the door wide open, he is greeted by the sight of Audrey standing quietly in the dimly lit hallway that surrounds him. With a subtle nod of acknowledgment, Audrey communicates to David, who stands transfixed, observing his wife as she begins to cry uncontrollably. Tears stream down her distraught face, overflowing to the point that her attempts to wipe them away with her hands prove futile, overwhelmed by their sheer volume. Audrey gives another nod, descending the stairs as she continues to brush away the tears from her face, while David watches with a heavy heart, his gaze following her as she gradually fades into the enveloping shadows below. The vast expanse of the stadium opens up dramatically under a picturesque, clear blue sky. A line of eager ticket holders winds its way patiently toward the two bustling turnstiles, where the dedicated stadium staff is actively engaged in the process of tearing tickets. Positioned strategically to one side, David Dunne stands with two other attentive security guards, keenly observing the enthusiastic fans around them, all decked out in their Eagles-themed clothing and accessories. Nearby, a lively group of animated girls carries a homemade banner, catching David's attention, prompting him to tilt his head to carefully read the message it bears. His gaze then shifts to a woman who is gently cradling a newborn baby in her arms; he notices with a smile that the infant is adorably dressed in a tiny Eagles uniform. Suddenly, the walkie-talkie situated on David's hip crackles to life with static, prompting him to quickly detach it and listen with focused intent. As he navigates his way through the bustling crowd, he inadvertently bumps into a man sporting a distinctive army jacket, casting a brief backward glance at him before continuing on his path. David proceeds to make his way over to a fellow security guard positioned near the turnstiles, situating himself close to the gate, facing the large throng of incoming spectators. Elijah approaches him, observing as the security team methodically pats down random male attendees as they pass through the turnstiles. In the line, the man wearing the green army jacket shuffles forward with an inscrutable expression, watching intently as the pat-down procedures unfold ahead of him. David maintains a vigilant watch over the man, noting his progress as he approaches, first twenty people away from the turnstile, then down to fifteen, and eventually just ten. Without warning, the man coughs loudly, stepping out of line in an abrupt manner, and Elijah observes as the distinctive green army jacket merges inconspicuously into the dense, bustling crowd, disappearing as the man retreats from the stadium's vicinity. In a shadowy and dimly lit arched concrete passageway, sunlight filters through from the stadium, casting long, elongated shadows across the space. Elijah stands alone, waiting patiently in this ground-level tunnel until David finally arrives, joining him and handing over a ticket. Elijah fixes his gaze on David, who exhales in a measured and deliberate manner while maintaining steady eye contact. As David's walkie bursts to life with a flurry of noise, the two men remain perfectly still, enveloped within the confines of the tunnel. David turns away, beginning to move down the hallway, speaking over his shoulder, as Elijah closely watches the silhouetted figure of David Dunne jog into the depths of the tunnel's enveloping darkness. Seated behind the wheel inside a uniquely customized car, Elijah is parked in the stadium's parking lot. The dashboard is layered with a thin foam padding, as are the steering wheel and gear shift, with every corner and hard surface thoughtfully safeguarded, providing meticulous protection throughout the vehicle.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: David, upon being startled, hastily retreats by placing the clippings back where he found them, then quickly stuffs the new one inside along with the others. He carefully returns the collection to its original spot on the top shelf and exits the cramped space of the closet. With a hand reaching out, he opens the door, revealing the dimly lit hall where Audrey stands waiting. As he steps back into the hallway, Audrey acknowledges him with a nod. David, momentarily transfixed, watches intently as Audrey's composure breaks and she begins to cry, tears slipping down the contours of her face. She attempts to manage the stream of tears with her hands, but the flow is relentless. Audrey nods again, her gesture imbued with unspoken understanding, and she makes her way down the staircase, her hands still working to clear her face of tears. David remains rooted to his spot, his eyes following her as she gradually disappears into the enveloping shadows below. The scene shifts to the expansive stadium, its immense structure opening under an immaculate blue sky. Outside, a line forms with eager ticket holders snaking towards the entrance where the stadium crew diligently rips tickets. David Dunne stands apart from the bustling queue, flanked by two fellow security guards, their collective gaze trained on the parade of fans, all adorned in Eagles merchandise. Among the crowd, a group of young girls hoists a homemade banner, catching David's eye, prompting him to tilt his head for a clearer view of the message. He then fixates on a woman holding a tiny, uniform-clad newborn, taking in the sight of the infant dressed in Eagles gear. Suddenly, the walkie-talkie clipped to David's hip crackles to life, pulling him from his observations. As David absorbs the transmission, he inadvertently bumps into a man in line donned in an army jacket. He momentarily glances back at the man, his curiosity fleeting, as he resumes his path. David strategically moves towards a fellow guard stationed near the turnstiles, setting his position at the gate and facing the thronging crowd. Elijah, arriving next to him, watches as their colleagues engage in random pat-downs of men progressing through the turnstiles. David’s attention zeroes in on the man in the green army jacket as he inches closer to the checkpoint, progressing from being the twentieth person in line to fifteenth, and then tenth. The man discreetly coughs, steps out of the line intentionally, and Elijah observes as the green army jacket vanishes into the dense crowd, slipping away imperceptibly from the stadium. In the dimness of a concrete passageway, sunlight filters through from the stadium, casting elongated shadows across the tunnel. Elijah stands waiting alone in the subterranean corridor when David enters, joining him and passing a ticket into his hand. Elijah looks over at David, who releases a steady breath, reciprocating Elijah's gaze. When David's walkie-talkie erupts with sudden noise, both men freeze, listening intently to the static. David pivots, initiates his walk down the passageway, and continues to converse over his shoulder with Elijah, who watches as David's silhouette fades, jogging deeper into the tunnel's enveloping darkness. Later, inside a uniquely customized car situated in the stadium's parking lot, Elijah sits behind the wheel. Every surface inside the vehicle—the dashboard, steering wheel, and gear shift—is covered in a layer of thin foam padding, ensuring that each corner and hard surface is carefully safeguarded.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: David quickly tidies up by putting the clippings back, adding the new one, and returning them to the top shelf before leaving the closet. He opens the door to find Audrey in the dim hall. She nods, and as David watches, she begins to cry. Despite her attempts to wipe away the tears, they keep coming. Audrey nods again, descends the stairs while wiping her face, and disappears into the shadows as David looks on. At the stadium, under a clear blue sky, a crowd lines up at the turnstiles where staff are checking tickets. David stands aside with two security colleagues, observing fans in Eagles gear. He reads a homemade banner carried by a group of girls and notices a woman with a newborn dressed in an Eagles outfit. His walkie-talkie crackles, prompting him to listen. After accidentally bumping into a man in an army jacket, David continues to a position near the turnstiles, where he watches the crowd. Elijah joins him, observing security checks. As the man in the army jacket approaches, David keeps an eye on him. The man steps out of line, and Elijah sees him vanish into the crowd away from the stadium. In the stadium tunnel, lit by streaming sunlight, Elijah waits alone until David arrives and hands him a ticket. They exchange a silent stare until David’s walkie erupts with noise. David turns to leave, speaking over his shoulder as he jogs down the tunnel, leaving Elijah in the shadows. Meanwhile, Elijah sits in his specially padded car in the stadium lot, with protective materials covering the dashboard, steering wheel, and gear shift.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description:
David gets startled, puts back the clippings, which are articles related to strange incidents he's investigating, stuffs the new one inside with them, replaces it back on the top shelf, and leaves the closet. He opens the door to find Audrey standing in the darkened hall of their suburban home, built in the 1970s and known for its quiet surroundings. Audrey nods, and David stares at his wife as she starts crying with tears rolling over her affected face, marked by recent stress and worry. She tries to wipe them away, but there's too many. Audrey nods, walks down the stairs that creak underfoot, emphasizing the age of their house, as she wipes her face, and David watches her disappear into the shadows. 

The cavernous stadium, Lincoln Financial Field, known as the home of the Philadelphia Eagles, opens up into a picture-perfect blue sky, with a line of ticket holders snaking towards two turnstiles where the stadium crew is meticulously ripping tickets to prevent counterfeiting. David Dunne stands to one side with two other security guards, observing the fans clad in Eagles paraphernalia, which includes jerseys and hats sporting the team's green and white colors. A group of girls carries a homemade banner supporting their favorite player, that David reads as he tilts his head sideways. He stares at a woman carrying a newborn infant in her arms, noticing the baby wearing an Eagles uniform, suggesting that the family are longtime fans instilling their passion in the next generation. The walkie-talkie on David's hip bursts to life, issuing updates about the crowd, and he pulls it off to listen. David bumps into a guy in line wearing an army jacket, a worn memento from his past service, then looks back at him and continues walking. 

David moves to a security guard near the turnstiles, a checkpoint ensuring the safety of attendees, walks to his post near the gate, and faces the crowd. Elijah, his colleague known for his keen observation skills, moves next to him and observes as a security team pats down random males moving through the turnstiles. The green army-jacketed man moves forward in line with a blank face, watching the pat-down ahead of him with apparent unease. David eyes him as he is twenty people from the turnstile, then fifteen, then ten. The man coughs, steps out of line, and Elijah watches the green army jacket melt into the thick crowd, disappearing as it moves away from the stadium, possibly suspicious of increased security. 

In an unlit arched concrete passageway beneath the stadium's seating, sunlight from the stadium streams in causing long shadows that dance on the walls. Elijah stands waiting in the ground tunnel by himself until David enters the tunnel and joins him, handing him a ticket that serves a purpose known only between them. Elijah stares at David, who exhales slowly while staring back. David's walkie erupts with noise, signaling an urgent situation needing attention, and the two men stand very still in the tunnel. David turns, starts down the hall, and talks back over his shoulder as Elijah watches the silhouetted figure of David Dunne jog beyond down the darkness of the tunnel. 

Inside a customized car designed for someone with a physical condition requiring extra protection, the dashboard is covered in thin foam padding, as are the steering wheel and gear shift, with every corner and hard surface safeguarded against injury. Elijah sits behind the wheel in the car parked in the stadium lot, contemplating his next move.

In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Elijah moves next to him and observes as a security team pats down random males moving through the turnstiles. The green armyjacketed man moves forward in line with a blank face watching the patdown ahead of him. David eyes him as he is twenty people from the turnstile then fifteen then ten. The man coughs steps out of line and Elijah watches the green army jacket melt into the thick crowd disappearing as it moves away from the stadium. In an unlit arched concrete passageway sunlight from the stadium streams in causing long shadows. Elijah stands waiting in the ground tunnel by himself until David enters the tunnel and joins him handing him a ticket. Elijah stares at David who exhales slowly while staring back. David's walkie erupts with noise and the two men stand very still in the tunnel. David turns starts down the hall and talks back over his shoulder as Elijah watches the silhouetted figure of David. Dunne jog beyond down the darkness of the tunnel. Inside a customized car the dashboard is covered in thin foam padding as are the steering wheel and gear shift with every corner and hard surface safeguarded. Elijah sits behind the wheel in the car parked in the stadium lot.

She tries to wipe them away but there is too many. Audrey nods walks down the stairs as she wipes her face and David watches her disappear into the shadows. test_cases.name: Subject Corruption
test_cases.description: A cat gets startled, puts back the clippings, stuffs the new one inside with them, replaces it back on the top shelf, and leaves the closet. The dog opens the door to find a giraffe standing in the darkened hall. The giraffe nods, and the cat stares at its wife as it starts crying with tears rolling over its affected face. It tries to wipe them away, but there's too many. The giraffe nods, walks down the stairs as it wipes its face, and the cat watches it disappear into the shadows. The cavernous stadium opens up into a picture-perfect blue sky, with a line of ticket holders snaking towards two turnstiles where the stadium crew is ripping tickets. A rabbit stands to one side with two other security guards, observing the fans clad in Eagles paraphernalia. A group of girls carries a homemade banner that the rabbit reads as it tilts its head sideways. It stares at a butterfly carrying a newborn infant in its arms, noticing the baby wearing an Eagles uniform. The walkie-talkie on the rabbit's hip bursts to life, and it pulls it off to listen. The rabbit bumps into a fox in line wearing an army jacket, then looks back at it and continues walking. The rabbit moves to a security guard near the turnstiles, walks to its post near the gate, and faces the crowd. A turtle moves next to it and observes as a security team pats down random males moving through the turnstiles. The green army-jacketed fox moves forward in line with a blank face, watching the pat-down ahead of it. The rabbit eyes it as it is twenty people from the turnstile, then fifteen, then ten. The fox coughs, steps out of line, and the turtle watches the green army jacket melt into the thick crowd, disappearing as it moves away from the stadium. In an unlit arched concrete passageway, sunlight from the stadium streams in causing long shadows. The turtle stands waiting in the ground tunnel by itself until a rabbit enters the tunnel and joins it, handing it a ticket. The turtle stares at the rabbit, who exhales slowly while staring back. The rabbit's walkie erupts with noise, and the two creatures stand very still in the tunnel. The rabbit turns, starts down the hall, and talks back over its shoulder as the turtle watches the silhouetted figure of the rabbit jog beyond down the darkness of the tunnel. Inside a customized car, the dashboard is covered in thin foam padding, as are the steering wheel and gear shift, with every corner and hard surface safeguarded. The turtle sits behind the wheel in the car parked in the stadium lot.

test_cases.name: Object Corruption
test_cases.description: David gets startled, puts back the cutlery, stuffs the new one inside with them, replaces it back on the top shelf, and leaves the pantry. He opens the gate to find Audrey standing in the dimly lit alley. Audrey nods, and David stares at his wife as she starts crying with tears rolling over her weathered face. She tries to wipe them away, but there's too many. Audrey nods, walks down the ramp as she wipes her face, and David watches her disappear into the mist. The cavernous library opens up into a picture-perfect blue lagoon, with a line of visitors snaking towards two entrances where the library crew is stamping books. David Dunne stands to one side with two other ticket agents, observing the tourists clad in vintage clothing. A group of girls carries a homemade quilt that David reads as he tilts his head sideways. He stares at a woman carrying a newborn puppy in her arms, noticing the puppy wearing a tiny hat. The smartphone on David's hip bursts to life, and he pulls it off to listen. David bumps into a guy in line wearing a raincoat, then looks back at him and continues walking. David moves to a clerk near the entrances, walks to his post near the archway, and faces the guests. Elijah moves next to him and observes as a visitor team pats down random females moving through the entrances. The yellow raincoat-wearing man moves forward in line with a blank face, watching the pat-down ahead of him. David eyes him as he is twenty people from the entrance, then fifteen, then ten. The man coughs, steps out of line, and Elijah watches the yellow raincoat dissolve into the thick crowd, disappearing as it moves away from the library. In a dimly lit arched brick passageway, moonlight from the lagoon streams in causing long shadows. Elijah stands waiting in the cavernous chamber by himself until David enters the chamber and joins him, handing him a map. Elijah stares at David, who exhales slowly while staring back. David's smartphone erupts with noise, and the two men stand very still in the chamber. David turns, starts down the alley, and talks back over his shoulder as Elijah watches the silhouetted figure of David Dunne stride beyond down the darkness of the passage. Inside a customized van, the dashboard is covered in silky velvet padding, as are the steering wheel and gear shift, with every corner and hard surface safeguarded. Elijah sits behind the wheel in the van parked in the library lot.

test_cases.name: Action Corruption
test_cases.description: David gets amused, rearranges the clippings, slips the new one inside with them, lifts it back onto the top shelf, and enters the closet. He pushes the door to find Audrey standing in the darkened hall. Audrey waves, and David blinks at his wife as she starts laughing with joy spreading across her serene face. She tries to capture the moment, but there’s too much. Audrey waves, climbs up the stairs as she mirrors her face, and David observes her vanish into the shadows. The cavernous stadium transforms into a picture-perfect blue sky, with a line of ticket holders drifting toward two turnstiles where the stadium crew is admiring tickets. David Dunne perches to one side with two other security guards, noting the fans clad in Eagles paraphernalia. A group of girls unfurls a homemade banner that David writes as he inclines his head sideways. He glances at a woman holding a newborn infant in her arms, observing the baby wearing an Eagles uniform. The walkie-talkie on David's hip springs to life, and he places it on his ear to chat. David brushes past a guy in line wearing an army jacket, then nods at him and continues strolling. David approaches a security guard near the turnstiles, skips to his post near the gate, and scans the crowd. Elijah moves next to him and wonders as a security team applauds random males moving through the turnstiles. The green army-jacketed man skips forward in line with a curious face, glancing at the pat-down ahead of him. David watches him as he is twenty people from the turnstile, then fifteen, then ten. The man sneezes, hops out of line, and Elijah watches the green army jacket float into the thick crowd, vanishing as it sails away from the stadium. In an unlit arched concrete passageway, sunlight from the stadium spills in casting long shadows. Elijah stands pondering in the ground tunnel by himself until David saunters into the tunnel and meets him, offering him a ticket. Elijah gazes at David, who smiles slowly while gazing back. David's walkie erupts with music, and the two men stand very still in the tunnel. David pivots, strides down the hall, and gestures back over his shoulder as Elijah watches the silhouetted figure of David Dunne skip beyond down the darkness of the tunnel. Inside a customized car, the dashboard is enveloped in thin silk padding, as are the steering wheel and gear shift, with every corner and hard surface polished. Elijah lounges behind the wheel in the car parked in the stadium lot.

test_cases.name: Subject-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Oliver gets startled, puts back the vegetables, stuffs the new one inside with them, replaces it back on the top shelf, and leaves the attic. He opens the window to find Rebecca standing in the dimly lit corridor. Rebecca nods, and Oliver stares at his cat as it starts crying with tears rolling over its affected fur. It tries to wipe them away, but there's too many. Rebecca nods, walks down the ladder as it wipes its fur, and Oliver watches it disappear into the mist. The cavernous aquarium opens up into a picture-perfect blue ocean, with a line of divers snaking towards two docks where the marine crew is checking gear. Oliver Twist stands to one side with two other lifeguards, observing the whales clad in penguin costumes. A group of dolphins carries a homemade banner that Oliver reads as he tilts his head sideways. He stares at a turtle carrying a tiny snail in its shell, noticing the snail wearing a penguin suit. The smartphone on Oliver's wrist bursts to life, and he pulls it off to listen. Oliver bumps into a penguin in line wearing a velvet coat, then looks back at it and continues swimming. Oliver moves to a lifeguard near the docks, floats to his station near the pier, and faces the sea. Max moves next to him and observes as a lifeguard team checks random fish moving through the docks. The velvet-coated penguin moves forward in line with a blank beak, watching the check ahead of it. Oliver eyes it as it is twenty fish from the dock, then fifteen, then ten. The penguin sneezes, flaps out of line, and Max watches the velvet coat meld into the thick swarm, disappearing as it moves away from the aquarium. In an unlit arched coral tunnel, sunlight from the ocean streams in causing long silhouettes. Max stands waiting in the sand tunnel by himself until Oliver enters the tunnel and joins him, handing him a seashell. Max stares at Oliver, who exhales slowly while staring back. Oliver's smartphone erupts with noise, and the two creatures stand very still in the tunnel. Oliver turns, starts down the path, and talks back over his shoulder as Max watches the silhouetted figure of Oliver Twist swim beyond down the darkness of the tunnel. Inside a customized submarine, the dashboard is covered in thin moss padding, as are the steering wheel and propeller shift, with every corner and hard surface safeguarded. Max sits behind the wheel in the submarine docked in the aquarium bay.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: Michael panics, tosses back the magazines, shoves the old one inside with them, positions it back on the bottom shelf, and exits the cupboard. He closes the window to find Lucy standing in the illuminated hallway. Lucy waves, and Michael gapes at his sister as she starts laughing with giggles spilling over her amused face. She attempts to hold them back, but there's too many. Lucy waves, ascends the stairs as she holds her sides, and Michael watches her vanish into the light. The expansive park opens up into a cloudy gray sky, with a row of tourists meandering toward three kiosks where the concert staff is checking bags. Michael Stone stands to one side with two other ushers, observing the visitors adorned in concert merchandise. A band of boys hoists a painted sign that Michael reads as he tilts his head backwards. He gapes at a man clutching a young puppy in his arms, noticing the puppy wearing a concert T-shirt. The pager on Michael's belt buzzes to life, and he takes it off to respond. Michael collides with a lady in line wearing a denim vest, then glances back at her and proceeds walking. Michael approaches an usher near the kiosks, strolls to his spot near the archway, and views the assembly. Charles moves beside him and watches as a team monitors random females moving through the kiosks. The purple denim-vested woman steps back in line with a calm expression, observing the monitoring ahead of her. Michael observes her as she is fifteen people from the kiosk, then ten, then five. The woman sneezes, steps back from the queue, and Charles observes the purple denim vest blend into the dense gathering, fading as it drifts away from the park. In a dim arched stone corridor, moonlight from the park streams in casting long silhouettes. Charles waits in the path alone until Michael enters the corridor and joins him, handing him a map. Charles examines Michael, who inhales deeply while gazing back. Michael's pager explodes with sound, and the two men stand very still in the corridor. Michael pivots, heads up the hallway, and comments back over his shoulder as Charles observes the shadowy outline of Michael Stone sprint beyond down the brightness of the passage. Inside a modified bicycle, the dashboard is enveloped in light foam padding, as are the handles and bell, with every angle and sharp surface protected. Charles sits on the seat in the bicycle parked in the park lot.

test_cases.name: Object-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: David gets amused, tosses aside the marbles, slides the shiny one among them, places it under the bottom shelf, and exits the attic. He closes the drawer to find Audrey seated in the illuminated kitchen. Audrey shakes her head, and David glances at his wife as she begins laughing with giggles echoing from her joyful mouth. She tries to stifle them, but there's too much. Audrey shakes her head, climbs up the ladder as she covers her mouth, and David watches her emerge into the sunlight. The narrow library reveals a stormy gray sky, with a line of readers drifting towards two desks where the library staff is stamping cards. David Dunne leans against a pillar with two other librarians, observing the visitors clad in Hawks attire. A pack of boys drags a handmade sculpture that David examines as he tilts his head sideways. He observes a man holding a small puppy in his arms, noticing the animal wearing a Hawks scarf. The radio on David's belt crackles to life, and he unhooks it to respond. David brushes past a woman in line wearing a detective coat, then glances back at her and keeps strolling. David approaches a librarian near the desks, strolls to his station near the shelves, and surveys the room. Elijah approaches him and watches as a library team guides various females approaching the desks. The blue detective-coated woman advances in line with a confused expression, observing the guidance ahead of her. David eyes her as she is twenty readers from the desk, then fifteen, then ten. The woman sneezes, slips out of line, and Elijah watches the blue detective coat blend into the sparse visitors, vanishing as it wanders towards the exit. In a dim, narrow wooden corridor, shadows from the library trickle in casting short lights. Elijah waits at the tunnel's edge by himself until David enters the passage and joins him, handing him a bookmark. Elijah examines David, who inhales deeply while gazing back. David's radio fills with chatter, and both men stand motionless in the passage. David swivels, strides up the stairs, and speaks over his shoulder as Elijah watches the silhouetted figure of David Dunne march upward into the brightness of the corridor. Inside a modified bus, the dashboard is wrapped in dense cotton padding, as are the steering column and pedals, with every edge and firm surface protected. Elijah sits at the controls in the bus parked in the library courtyard.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Mortimer is surprised, pushes the buttons, shoves the old one among them, moves it back to the bottom drawer, and exits the pantry. He closes the window to find Penelope standing in the illuminated kitchen. Penelope waves, and Mortimer glances at his sister as she begins laughing with smiles spreading across her delighted face. She attempts to hold it back, but there's too much. Penelope waves, heads up the ladder as she covers her mouth, and Mortimer observes her emerge onto the rooftop. The expansive garden unfolds into a stormy gray sky, with a row of buyers dragging towards three kiosks where the park staff is handing out maps. Mortimer Mallory stands near a bench with four other lifeguards, inspecting the visitors dressed in Jaguars merchandise. A cluster of boys waves a knitted banner that Mortimer reviews as he tilts his head backwards. He glances at a lady juggling a sleeping kitten in her arms, noticing the kitten sporting a Jaguars cap. The pager on Mortimer's belt crackles to quiet, and he clips it on to speak. Mortimer stumbles upon a woman in a coat wearing a velvet robe, then glances at her and keeps running. Mortimer shifts to a lifeguard beside the kiosks, strides to his spot by the fence, and observes the throng. Gordon shifts next to him and assesses as a lifeguard team tags down random females passing through the kiosks. The blue velvet-robed woman steps backward in line with a curious expression, observing the tagging at the rear of her. Mortimer watches her as she is thirty paces from the kiosk, then twenty-five, then twelve. The woman chuckles, moves into line, and Gordon watches the blue velvet robe fade into the thin mob, vanishing as it travels away from the park. In a dim gleaming brick corridor, moonlight from the garden streams in creating short silhouettes. Gordon stands waiting in the area tunnel by himself until Mortimer comes into the passage and joins him, handing him a map. Gordon peers at Mortimer, who inhales quickly while looking back. Mortimer's pager blasts with silence, and the two gentlemen stand very motionless in the passageway. Mortimer pivots, ascends the room, and whispers back over his hand as Gordon watches the shadowy figure of Mortimer Mallory skip beyond into the brightness of the corridor. Inside a painted van, the dashboard is adorned in thick carpet fibers, as are the steering wheel and pedals, with every edge and sharp surface cushioned. Gordon sits by the door in the van parked in the garden lot.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: David gets startled, replaces the clippings on the top shelf, and leaves the closet to find Audrey in the hall. Audrey nods, then cries while walking downstairs, disappearing into the shadows. At the stadium, David Dunne stands with security guards, watching fans. He notices a woman with a newborn in Eagles gear and reads a group’s banner. A guy in an army jacket catches David's attention as the security team pats down fans. The man exits the line and vanishes into the crowd. In a stadium tunnel, Elijah waits until David joins him and hands him a ticket. They stand silently until David leaves, jogging down the tunnel. Elijah then sits in a customized car with padded surfaces in the stadium lot.
